title: Columbus man arrested for shooting 4-year-old with BB gun
content:
A Columbus man was arrested by Urbana Police on Friday following the shooting of a 4-year-old with an airsoft BB gun on August 31st.
Chad L. King, of Columbus, was taken into custody and charged with assault and obstructing official business.
Police say King admitted to his involvement in the shooting, which injured a 4-year-old girl near her home.
Police say King was a student at Urbana University at the time of the shooting and was driving back to campus when the shots were fired, injuring the girl.
Officers recovered an airsoft BB gun that was thrown away in a dumpster on the Urbana University campus.
Ubana Police are investigating other recent BB gun shootings that injured other victims in the area, and are following up on information that other people may be involved in those incidents.
No one has been charged in those incidents yet.
King remains out on bond and is expected to appear in court on Tuesday.
Urbana University issued the following statement about the incident: “Urbana University takes the safety of its campus, students, faculty, staff and surrounding community seriously. To this end, each student is provided and agrees to a Student Code of Conduct detailing expected behavior while enrolled as an Urbana University student. In cases of student misconduct, a disciplinary course of action is initiated and outcomes prescribed based on the policy violation. The University will continue to monitor this situation and will take appropriate actions as updates become available.”
